instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024B: What is 820-3024B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: THIS BOARD have 3 BEEPS, is it possible to repair this board? and this does not return the same problem, or I don't invest time in this repair? board trash?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Could be RAM issue, but also CPU.
Also can be broken solders/traces under RAM, or CPU.

If you want to invest time, should CHANGE ALL RAM chips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: reflow ram memory or cpu not a good idea? it is possible return the same problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
